113222.content:
"GOOD MORNING ICHIGO!"

The typical wake up call of the Kurosaki house sounded as loud as ever as Isshin Kurosaki burst in through his son's bedroom door with a flying kick as usual, and as usual his son was far more than prepared to dodge him.

"Give it a rest already old man!"

Glaring at the black haired girl now flat on her back on his bed, Ichigo brushed his short black hair out of his face, obviously in the way because of his bedhead since he had just been woken up.

"And why is it that you still have to pull this kind of crap even with Karin's body? What would you do if you ended up hurting your own daughter while you were her?"

Isshin seemed to flip himself backwards off Ichigo's bed and land square on his feet, standing before Ichigo in one of his sisters' bodies which, for once, made him actually seem just a tad bit intimidating. That was actually a sad thing.

"Relax already will ya. Karen's a tough girl to begin with, what with her soccer and everything. I traded her our durabilities when we swapped. You know your old man can take a hit and keep going for days."

The grown man turned young child sounded proud about such a contradictory aspect of himself. Ichigo however simply couldn't believe the new levels of stupid his father had reached. A few more moments of bickering between Ichigo and his father turned sister passed before the teenager was able to get his father out of his room once again. With a sigh he shut his door, placing his back against it. Another moment passed and he began to get changed out of his sleepwear and leaving himself in only his boxers with his small but perky breasts on prominent display for nobody else to see.

---------------------

Now, a moment's pause in our story to take an understanding of this new world and the current situation. The battle against Aizen for the fate of Karakura town, Soul Society, and everything that the Soul King's power touched. With Ichigo having proven victorious the world was able to recover, save for the one abnormality that somehow triggered. The laws of reality across the various worlds seemed to have altered, yet nobody seemed to notice a difference. All throughout The World of the Living, Soul Society, and Hueco Mundo the inhabitants had taken on the ability to trade whatever they wanted between each other, from things as simply as clothing and personal belongings to things as improbable as bodies, physical traits and even mental aspects. Some even found they could use this to even trade things like social standings or roles. Since the loss of his Shinigami powers Ichigo was no longer able to travel between the worlds and his Shinigami friends that had been stationed in the World of the Living to assist him had returned to the Soul Society to resume their lives and jobs. As a parting gift Ichigo found Rukia, the girl who had spent most of their time together living in his bedroom closet, trading her body for his.

----------------------

Now dressed once again in the male student's uniform of his high school, having been resized to his new body like all of his other clothes once Riku had given it to him, he walked out of his room and downstairs to join the rest of his family for breakfast.

Gravity wasn't as strong, so everything was lighter, making them easier to lift and for things to jump and fall, and fly. But that wasn't the only thing that changed, the effect of friction was reversed, so rough surfaces would be slippy and harder to grab onto while smooth surfaces would be hard to move things along. However the rift had one last effect, this was how things had always being, so for everyone, this made sense and was normal, everyone except for Natsu thought like this, Natsu was the only one who knew of the difference.

Natsu was shuffling the morning after the rift had messed up the world, as he slept on his side, on his sleep, he had kicked a little, but the slightly rough surface of the bed made his leg slide further, and into the wall, which pushed him back, and forced him to slide of the bed, and crash onto the floor, taking longer than normally, waking himself and Happy up with a bang, but not as loud as expected. "What going on!" Happy yelled in surprise, "Oh, Natsu, did you slide out of bed again, I told you that bed was getting to rough." Natsu was just plain confused, almost every Happy had just said was wrong for him, "Happy," Natsu said trying to get up, but slipped on the wooden floor. "Natsu, didn't I remind you to polish the floor yesterday, you not putting enough friction between you and the floor or bed." Natsu had to protest, "Why would polish add friction, it makes things smoother."
Happy nodded, "Exactly, smoothing means more friction," to which Natsu protested again, "Natsu the evidence is at your feet. Come on at the rate you going, if we don't go now, we won't make it to the guild before it time for us to go on a mission," Happy said flying off.

11422.content:
The Rift has altered the reality of the land of Fiore. Now, all persons, wizard or not, are able to exchange any aspect of themselves with another!

This is done in much the same way as a contract. Both parties must agree to exchange the desired aspect for a determined amount of time. The terms of the contract begin when the two parties shake hands. Once they do, the desired aspect is immediately exchanged. After the terms are met, the exchange immediately undos itself.

To the vast majority in Fiore, this has been the norm throughout their entire lives; the Rift had made sure of that. However, just because one reality is lost doesn't mean it is forgotten.

Who still remembers the old reality, and will have to adjust to the new reality the Rift created?

114221112.content:
Erza walked briskly into Lucy's apartment, being sure to close the door behind her. "Are you saying you forgot about Swap Magic? How could you be so careless?!"

Lucy shuttered and said, "Well, maybe it's just that I'm so tired, but would you care explaining it to me again?" Lucy tried to pass off her lack of knowledge about Swap Magic in order to throw off Erza.

It seemed to work as Erza guided Lucy toward the center of her apartment and said, "Here, let me explain. Swap Magic is a powerful magic, yet anybody can use it. Even the people of Edolas, from what I observed, could perform this magic without tools."

"That's incredible!" Lucy said.

"I know, it shocked me, too. Anyway, as the name implies, Swap Magic is used to swap a trait between two people. However, no one can just use this magic on a whim. Certain requirements have to be agreed upon by the two parties involved in the swap."

"So, it's like a contract between me and my Celestial Spirits?"

"Correct. The contract in this case would involve what would be swapped between the two individuals and for how long. For example, if I was to draw up a contract with you to exchange casual clothes, not only would you have to agree, but we both would also have to settle on a time in which we would keep our exchanged clothes."

"I think I get it! So if you wanted to take my casual clothes, I'd tell you that I'd only be comfortable being without them for a week."

"I'd say a week would be perfectly fine for me."

"So then what happens?"

Erza extended her hand as she said, "To finalize the contract, we shake hands."

Lucy reached out and grasped Erza's hand firmly. "Like this?"

As soon as Lucy let go of Erza's hand, she was amazed to see the redhead wearing what she had just put on. The white tube top accentuated her breasts beautifully and the blue vest and sleeves seemed to smoothly fit on her body. The blue miniskirt and black boots also did a lot to highlight her legs.

Lucy looked to herself and saw that she was now wearing a white sleeveless shirt with ruffles down the middle and a blue tie. A blue skirt that went halfway to her knees and black boots just below her knees completed the outfit.

Erza smiled and said, "Yes, exactly like that."

"You tricked me!!"

"Don't be so dramatic. The best way to explain Swap Magic is through demonstration."

"That doesn't mean you can steal my clothes!!"

"Au contraire, Lucy. You shook my hand, so you willingly gave them to me," Erza said. She then shuffled slightly and commented, "I will have to get used to this underwear you have, though."

"Why do you even want them, anyway?"

"If you must know the truth, then I'm ashamed to admit that I want to feel what it's like to wear clothes that aren't mine."

Wendy interrupted their conversation by saying, "Anyway, Lucy, if you don't mind, may I please borrow your magic for my next mission?"

Lucy thought about it and said...

Did she really just forget about it or did she not know about it? She shook her head she shouldn't be doubting her friend.

She said, "Hey Lucy I tried out your whip skills earlier and your athleticism it did work well enough, but it did feel a tad strange with my body and those skills could we switch bodies and voices with each other. My body is a lot smaller then yours, so I tire out quickly. And since you're interested swapping maybe we could do that. Would that be okay with you?"

Lucy thought for a moment Wendy had a point she may have her athletic, whip skills, and magic, but her body may not have the same stamina as she did. And she was interested in trying a few more swaps, so she decided she would go for it.

Lucy smiled, "Sure that is fine with me Wendy. Besides I've always kind of wondered what its like being carried by Carla in the air. I mean Happy has carried me before, but it isn't the most comfortable ride. We should also probably switch wardrobes, since my uh...body is a bit more developed then yours." She saw Wendy glance down at her chest and frown. Lucy said, "I'm sorry Wendy its just that well."

Wendy shook her head, "No its fine Lucy I know you didn't mean any harm by it. Let's swap then." She held out her hand to Lucy. "Lucy Heartfillia will you swap bodies,voices, and clothes with me?"

Lucy said, "I will Wendy Marvell."

"Will you swap these traits for the next two days?" Wendy continued.

"I will." Lucy agreed and shook the linked hands. After the deed was done there was no flash of light or anything, but Lucy was struck with a bit of vertigo after the swap and put her hand on head by the sudden shock. She saw blue hair fall in front of her face. She looked at where Wendy had been and saw herself there. The only real difference was that Wendy still had her Fairy Tail mark where it used to be. She looked down at herself and saw she was dressed in Wendy's green dress. She definitely felt a lot lighter now due to the swap, but considering Wendy was 13 years that made sense.

Lucy said, "This is so strange I feel like I've had your body all my life even though I haven't." She was amazed she sounded exactly like Wendy. To most eyes she looked exactly like Wendy the only real difference was that she still had the same Fairy Tail mark on her hand.

Wendy giggled, "Yeah I feel the same way. If I remember right you haven't swapped bodies with anyone before have you?"

Lucy shook her head, "No not really. Have you swapped bodies with someone before?"

Wendy shook her head, "No I haven't. Romeo wanted to swap bodies with me before, but I was too embarrassed to agree to it."

Carla approached the two as they chatted, "Indeed this is both your first time having swapped bodies with someone. While with how swap magic works you two shouldn't have any problems I would very much like for you two to practice a bit before we leave for the mission. We have 45 minutes until the train leave, so I advise we make use of that time."

Both Wendy and Lucy nodded and headed to the training yard behind the guild to practice.

Natsu in Lisanna's body said, "Well Lucy if you want to practice lets have a sparring match. Lets see how good of a Dragon Slayer you are."

Lisanna in Natsu's body said, "Yeah Wendy lets see how well you handle that whip."

Both Wendy and Lucy could tell the swapped pair wasn't going to take no for an answer. They took positions across from each other. Carla gave the signal and the match began. Lisanna used her cat take over magic and charged towards Wendy in Lucy's body. Lucy saw Lisanna charging and quickly cast Verneir on both herself and Wendy. Wendy immediately summoned Loke who began with a Regulus Charge attack. She took advantage of the speed boost Lucy had given her and got to Lisanna's side and used her whip to tangle up Lisanna immobilizing her. Loke landed his hit and it pushed Lisanna back quite a bit hitting one of the dummies.
Meanwhile Natsu had jumped into the air and used his Fire Dragon Wing attack to try and hit Lucy who easily dodged thanks to the speed boost. As soon as Natsu landed Lucy jumped into the air and used Sky Dragon Roar and managed to hit Natsu who was pushed back hard into the wall of the guild. Seeing that Natsu was stunned she charged forwards used Sky Dragon Crushing Fang on Natsu knocking him out.

Lisanna and Natsu were defeated. Lucy immediately went over and healed them. Thought after healing them she felt drained. Why surely Wendy's body had more magic power then that.

Wendy saw this and said, "You're probably just tired cause your aren't used to my magic and you put a lot more force into those attacks then you needed to. Don't worry though you can just eat some air and you'll be all set." Lucy nodded and ate some air. It was strange it was hard to describe the taste. It was kind of sweet probably because there isn't a lot of pollution in Magnolia.

Natsu groaned, "Thanks Lucy, but dang it Lisanna your body can't take a hit from a few Sky Dragon attacks come on. You couldn't even land a hit."
Lisanna countered, "Neither could you Natsu. Your body isn't used to my take over magic, so I couldn't do much." The two childhood friends continued to bicker with each other.

Lucy turned to Carla who had been watching, "Do you think that was enough Carla?"

Carla sighed, "Yes you have cleared my worries. Just be careful Lucy I don't want Wendy's body badly hurt when she gets it back."

Lucy nodded, "I will Carla don't worry."

Carla said, "Very well lets head to the station." Lucy and Wendy nodded and head to the station. Once they were on the train Lucy decided to ask, "So Wendy what kind of mission are we doing?"

Wendy began to answer.

The morning sun broke through the windows of Levy's apartment in Fairy Hills, the golden rays falling on her face which sat half buried in an open book laid out on a small table where she had seemed to fall a sleep the night before. Yawning she began to wake up just like any other day, not even phased by the common practice of falling asleep in the middle of a book. Walking out of her apartment and through Fairy Hills towards the bathing area she hummed to herself, occasionally tucking a stray strand of her blue hair behind her ear.

Once in the bath she discarded her clothes and slipped into the hot waters, enjoying the relaxing feeling they had on her curvy shape. Looking down at herself she sighed.

"I love that Lu-chan let me borrow her body again but I'm always so sad when the time runs out on our agreement."

She knew that within a few hours it would be Lucy's body once again and the thought saddened her still.

1253.content:
Astrid was out with Stormfly, early as the Sun was just peeking over the horizon. She'd done her jobs for the day, and the skies were clear and fresh.

She loved Stormfly, more than she could say, more than she'd admit. But she wasn't a nightfury. So she took as much time to work on her skills and knowledge as she could.

They bobbed and weaved between the trees, as deftly as others. Her tail lashing out barbs, each one hitting the target. Astrid was overjoyed, in a flash the forest vanished, and the pair shot out of the trees. Behind them the cliff receded, and beneath them the waves crashed.

To cool down, she guided Stormfly at a leisurely pace between the sea stacks, as she edged her Deadly Nadder back along the coast towards the village.

Abruptly, she dug her heels in. As much as you can with dragon hide. There was something down on the beach... something weird. It caught the light oddly, shifting and sparkling like a jewel, but more colourful, and brighter.

125311.content:
Astrid was ecstatic; it was something that she hadn't seen in her whole life and her interest in the object influenced her decision to seek the object. At a relatively brisk pace, she guided Stormfly into a descent onto the sand of the beach with the intention of getting closer to the object.

Unsurprisingly, Stormfly's claws touched the warm grains the sand quickly which allowed Astrid to jump off safely onto the beach. Now metres away from the flashing light, strangely in the shape of a jewel, her instinct persuaded her to walk towards it, as if it's calling for her presence. A small part of her mind was screaming at her, nagging her to step back but those feelings subsided as a new emotion of discovery made her reach out her arm to touch the object. But as fate would have it, the moment her skin connected with the light, she was instantaneously knocked back a few metres, and the flashing light disappeared.

For a second, it felt like reality shifted around her, the bright and vast landscape turned a tad more vibrant than usual before everything turned back to normal. Mostly normal anyway. For Astrid, it felt like the sand was slightly less lively, and the temperature was oddly a bit colder as well as the trees being more menacing than she remembered... but there was definitely one change that did not belong with her. She glared at the brown creature in front of her, slowly waking up from its presumed slumber.

"Uh... I rhink I ate too rany Scooby Snacks!" the brown creature groaned, "I guess I imagined that.

Astrid blinked several times over what she witnessed. I mean sure, the small brown beast might've been believable because she'd seen crazier things happen over the course of her existence but still, having that said creature talk, was completely strange.

"You just talked!" Astrid gasped.

The brown dog stared straight at the blonde teen, dumbfounded at her question.

"Rid rou rit rour read Rastrid?" the dog asked in an offended tone.

Upon hearing her name, Astrid immediately turned hostile, raising her fists and preparing to fight with the brown beast, "How do you even know my name?"

"I'm rour rest riend!" he said, putting her "Ron't rou remember?"

Astrid shook her head.

"Rou rit rour read retty rard! Ret's ro rack ro re rillage rere Relma ran rort rou rout!"

Astrid was about to blurt out the fact that there was no-one in the village who went by the name of 'Velma' but decided against it, just in case she was indeed the crazy one.

"Okay, we can travel on Stormfly," Astrid stated as she looked behind, pointing at the dragon that she rode on. Only... it wasn't Stormfly she pointed at. It was...

Astrid woke up on the sandy beach with a massive headache, feeling hot and sweaty. Her first thought was to relieve herself from the discomfort. To cool down, she jumped into the cold ocean, washing away all the dirt and grime she must've accumulated from the crash. Once she felt more comfortable, she looked around, trying to find where her dragon Stormfly flew off to. It was awfully strange for her to abandon Astrid, making her think that something suspicious was going around. Maybe it was just her imagination but she also swore the beach looked a lot different than the one that she observed.

choices: Star vs. The Forces of Evil
1253322.content:
The six of them watched as a suited man walked out of a portal and snapped his fingers instantly. Immediately, their surroundings changed drastically from a green grassy island to an enormous and circular futuristic room that looked like a secret home base built for some government agency. On the left, right and front sides of the room were various flashing buttons and television screens showing different things from a sword-wielding pre-teen fighting monsters to a bunch of anthropomorphic animals working at a park. There was some control panel on a table near the front, which hosted a large screen directly in front of it. Just behind the screens was a long red bench that looked comfortable to the average person. Astrid, Stormfly, Scooby and Shaggy had their eyes focused on the television screens while Velma and Stan Ford only looked around the room, mentally taking notes.

For a few minutes, the man in the suit just allowed them to explore and get themselves immersed, until-

"You may be wondering why I brought you all here," the man interrupted them, greeted everyone with some thick British accent.

"Yes, I am indeed curious," Stan Pines was the next to speak, "Where are we exactly?"

"Sorry sir but that is classified information," the suited man replied, "However, I am allowed to debrief everyone on why we transported are here."

"That's a start," Shaggy mumbled, "But where are the snacks?'

"Right at the end of the room, on the table," the man smiled, pointing towards a table stacked with food, both familiar and peculiar, "We specifically catered to everyone's tastes, including Stormfly.

"I'm seriously confused here," Astrid coughed a little, staring at the gizmos and gadgets of various shapes and sizes that were flashing and blinking at her in rapid succession. She sat on one of the chairs situated in the middle of the room, "How do you even know what I named her?"

"I know more than what you even know about yourself, Astrid," the man said ominously before changing the subject, "I have brought you all here because each of you is specialised in a particular skill that can help the various realities from breaking apart."

"Various realities?" Velma asked, "You mean like a temporal rift that can break the fabrics of a black hole. But that's impossible."

"You are partially correct Velma but also wrong. You see, it has to do with relocating the physical en-"

"Just get to the point," Astrid crossed her arms.

"Fine! All of you are now responsible for managing the alternative realities that have accidently been created from the infinite multiverse. Fortunately for everyone, I only assigned you the western side of the Terra Section of the universe, so it will not be a lot of work compared to some others that I have also recruited."

"What do you mean by... manage?" Stan Ford inquired for further information.

"And you said there are others," Scooby added on.

The man in the suit sighed, "That doesn't matter. Besides, I have yet to explain the concept. In every alternative reality, there will always be at least one entity who is actively aware that their originating reality had changed. Usually, this is relative safe as the changes from their original and altered world is minuscule to reasonable."

"I'm following."

"Velma, I have yet to explain the potential problems," The man's expression changed into a frown, obviously concerned, but still his tone remained calm and professional, "However, there are rare instances where they get sidetracked. This includes mental breakdowns, psychotic episodes, hurting bystanders, losing their character, the like."

"Yikes," Shaggy commented, even though he was more concerned about the temperature of the hot dish he was just eating from the food table.

"Your jobs are to observe and use the mechanisms and devices on the control panels to make sure that they don't break the status quo. Just in case it happens. Do you understand me?"

The man received a couple of nods as a response. Satisfied with this, the man took out a remote control from out of his pocket and handed it to the old man with glasses.

"Stanford Pines, I know how hard it must've been for the last thirty years, but I can tell that you are the most responsible and the most experienced out of everyone. I'm handing you this device which will allow everyone to watch whatever reality they choose."

The suited man smiled at everyone and addressed his final words, "For now, just enjoy the show. Grab some popcorn and a cola, relax and sit back. You're not going anywhere else for a while so just watch. Also, just be wary of anything suspicious going on in these realities."

Before anyone could answer back or ask any more questions, he snapped his fingers and disappeared without a trace."

Stan looked at the remote and pressed the On button, like any other regular television remote and started watching...

-------

info.brief_description: A strange temporal rift distorts the realities of the worlds of multiple fandoms!!
info.description:
In each fandom's world, a strange ripple in time distorts reality to extreme proportions. Only a handful of people in each reality remember life like it was; everyone else treats the new reality as the way things have always been.

What reality distortions have happened? Well, it could be any number of possibilities. The "Naruto" universe might have become one where women don't believe in wearing anything but sexy/revealing clothes; the "Bleach" universe might have every character being students in high school; the "One Piece" universe might now have body swapping as a regular occurrence. The possibilities are endless!!

Rules:

1: No killing off of characters
2: No breaking off into different stories
3: No introduction of parallel universes!! Keep each alternate reality self-contained.
